result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles T Braun was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time.
Court will allow all trustee credit to be applied to this case if the defendant is revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.
Cases 15CM2328 and 16CM94 were dismissed and read in.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) with all standard release conditions.
STAYED - to be used at Agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt: Judgment of Unpaid Fines, Forfeitures and other Financial Obligations returned.

Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Charles T Braun in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.



Court orders the following:
6 Months in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
Court will allow all trustee credit to be applied to this case if the Defendant is revoked.
STAYED.

Term of Probation:  1 Year.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.

Costs:  $243
Bail to be refunded to the posting party.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME: 
30 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
STAYED - To be used at agent's discretion.
Response letter to the defendant from Court advising him that his letter regarding the refunding of bail was referred to the Clerk of Courts Business Center.

ADDRESS INFO for Charles T Braun
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 01-26-2016)
Prior: W166 N8638 Theodore Avenue, Menomonee Falls, WI 53051
filed by defendant regarding his $250.00 cash bail.
Letter from court clerk to defendant in response to his letter filed 1/20/16. Court taking no action, defendant must provide further information.
Filed by defendant reqeusting credit of 275 to use for his books.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.   Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.   Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program.   Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.   Defendant to report within the first business day after posting bail or released from custody. Court orders $500.00 from Case #15CM2328 to be applied to this case.

Defendant Charles T Braun in court, in custody, with attorney Nicole Masnica for  Katie B. Bricco.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for February 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
